questions.question: Which protocol is used for secure communication over the internet, using encryption?
What is the purpose of the DHCP protocol?

options.A: To assign IP addresses dynamically to devices on a network
options.B: To resolve domain names to IP addresses
options.C: To establish secure connections between servers

questions.question: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for end-to-end communication and flow control?
Which of the following is a feature of a switch compared to a hub?

options.A: Broadcasts data to all connected devices
options.B: Forwards data only to the specific device it is intended for

questions.question: In a typical home network, which device connects your local network to the Internet?
What type of network attack involves flooding a network with an excessive amount of traffic to overwhelm its resources and cause a denial of service?
In the context of Quality of Service (QoS), what is the purpose of the Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) field in IP headers?

options.A: It specifies the source IP address.
options.B: It indicates the packet's priority and treatment.

questions.question: Which cryptographic protocol is commonly used to secure email communications, providing encryption and authentication for email messages?
What is the primary purpose of the BGP (Border Gateway Protocol) in the context of the global Internet?

options.A: It ensures end-to-end encryption of data.
options.B: It controls the routing of data between autonomous systems (ASes).
options.C: It assigns IP addresses to network devices.
options.D: It filters malicious traffic at the network edge.

questions.question: Which network addressing technique allows multiple devices to share a single public IP address, typically used in home networks?
In the context of network security, what is 'zero-day vulnerability'?

options.A: A vulnerability that has existed for zero days
options.B: A vulnerability that has been patched for zero days
options.C: A vulnerability that is unknown to the software vendor
options.D: A vulnerability that affects zero devices

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a DNSSEC (Domain Name System Security Extensions) implementation?

options.B: To prevent DNS spoofing and cache poisoning attacks
options.C: To allocate IP addresses to domain names
options.D: To increase the speed of DNS resolution

questions.question: Which network monitoring tool or protocol allows administrators to capture and analyze network traffic for troubleshooting and security analysis?
What is the key benefit of using a Virtual LAN (VLAN) in a network?

options.B: It isolates broadcast domains and enhances network security.
options.C: It provides end-to-end encryption for data transmission.

questions.question: What protocol is commonly used for secure remote file transfer over a network, encrypting both commands and data?
In a multicast communication model, which address type is used to identify a group of receivers?
What is the purpose of a Honeypot in network security?

options.A: To detect and prevent network intrusions
options.B: To collect information about attackers and their methods

questions.question: In the context of network performance optimization, what does 'QAM' stand for?
Which of the following is not a commonly used wireless security protocol for securing Wi-Fi networks?
What is the purpose of the Diffie-Hellman key exchange in cryptography and secure communication?

options.B: To establish a shared secret key between two parties
options.C: To authenticate users in a network
options.D: To verify the integrity of digital signatures
